items.sentence: Tom says he\'s planning to go back to Boston for Christmas.
Tom says he\'s planning to take Mary out to dinner tonight.
Tom says that he and Mary didn\'t stay in Boston very long.
Tom bent down and picked up the money he saw on the ground.
I can\'t tell you everything that happened to me yesterday.
I can\'t thank you enough for agreeing to help me with Tom.
I can\'t think of any reason not to tell Tom what happened.
I certainly hope that you\'re planning to come to my party.
Tom knew Mary was probably not going to be able to do that.
Tom knew he barely had enough time to do what he had to do.
Did Tom tell Mary what time she needed to be here tomorrow?
I found something in the box that I didn\'t expect to find.
I haven\'t eaten or drunk anything since yesterday morning.
I don\'t think Tom told Mary the truth about what happened.
What time does Tom think we should get up tomorrow morning?
Tom persuaded the store manager to give him back his money.
Tom put some water into the kettle and put it on the stove.
I take it you don\'t approve of the way Tom\'s been acting.
I don\'t think Tom is as selfish as everybody thinks he is.
I thought about heading over to Tom\'s, but decided not to.
